TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {115019=Audio only: 1200 (G.711) or 200 in high quality mode (G.722/G.729), 99585=For additional information about supported IBM server equivalents, see: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/prod/collateral/voicesw/ps6790/ps5748/ps378/product_solution_overview0900aecd80091615.html., 54160=2.40 GHz E5-2665/115W 8C/20MB Cache/DDR3 1600MHz-2 (Sub-component of UCS B200 M3 Blade Server w/o CPU, mem, HDD, mLOM/mezz (UPG)), 76731=1750, 76581=1500, 51746=Cisco UCS VIC 1240 modular LOM for M3 blade servers, 84359=Cisco WebEx Node is deployed as a shared port adapter for the Cisco ASR 1000 series router., 91474=Cisco ASR 1000 router, 76882=2000, 76431=1250, 76763=1162, 27463=LSI 2008 SAS RAID Mezzanine Card for UCS C220 server, 95210=1.0.0.3 (MPWinOS_VM_1003.iso), 76281=1000, 27107=8GB DDR3-1600-MHz RDIMM/PC3-12800/dual rank/1.35v, 113944=Audio: 2000 (G.711) or 1328 (G.722/G.729/iLBC), 113673=Audio: 2000 (G.711) or 1328 (G.722/G.729/iLBC), 25370=C220 M3S (SFF) TRC#1 platform is supported for A/O and T1 deployments with total of 1200 SRUs., 39041=R2XX-CMAG3-1032, 26859=UCS-CPU-E5-2665, 26931=2.40 GHz E5-2665/115W 8C/20MB Cache/DDR3 1600MHz, 111537=Table: Audio and Video Scalability Numbers for Cisco Unified MeetingPlace lists the maximum number of calls that are supported. The table assumes that the G.711 audio codec is being used and video is 320 Kbps. Many design external transcoding resources on DSP farms in Multiservice Routers to transcode G.722/G.729/iLBC codecs to G.711 before sending to MeetingPlace to achieve the G.711 codec capacities. See Planning the Capacity of your Cisco Unified MeetingPlace System for detailed information about System Resource Units (SRUs) that are used to calculate the capacity of the Express Media Server. The server listed is the server on which the Application Server resides., 54417=8GB DDR3-1600-MHz RDIMM/PC3-12800/dual rank/1.35v-3 (Sub-component of UCS B200 M3 Blade Server w/o CPU, mem, HDD, mLOM/mezz (UPG)), 76914=1328, 68122=For additional information about supported IBM server equivalents, see: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/prod/collateral/voicesw/ps6790/ps5748/ps378/product_solution_overview0900aecd80091615.html., 117163=You can optionally install a Cisco WebEx Node For MCS (on a MCS or on a virtual machine) that can accommodate up to 500 web sessions. You can add additional Cisco WebEx Node For MCS to increase the number of web meetings, up to a maximum of four, for a total of 2000 web sessions (overall, not in a single meeting), in multinode deployments with Cisco WebEx scheduling.}
textBeforeTable: Component-specific requirements are indicated in the following table: LAN connection must support up to 1GB/s Install one virtual machine, per blade on a supported Cisco Unified Computer Server (UCS) VMware ESXi 4.1 running Enterprise Plus Edition VMware license for Cisco UCS C240 M3/C220 M3/C210 M2/B200 M3/B200 M2 and Standard or Enterprise Plus for Cisco UCS C200 M2. VMware ESXi 5.0 and 5.0 Update 1 (Release 8.5.5 [8.5 MR3] only). The VMware Standard license is sufficient for the Cisco UCS C240 M3, the Cisco UCS C220 M3, the Cisco UCS C210 M2, the Cisco UCS C200 M2, the Cisco UCS B200 M3, and the UCS B200 M2. The VMware Enterprise Plus license is also supported. Virtual Machine Requirements For information about how to configure RAID settings on the UCS B or C series server, see the "Installing on a Virtual Machine" section of the Installation, Upgrade, and Migration Guide for Release 8.5 at http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/sw/ps5664/ps5669/prod_installation_guides_list.html. For scalability information, see Scalability for Cisco Unified MeetingPlace Release 8.5. For system capacity information, see System Capacity Quick Reference Tables. Notes: Cisco Unified MeetingPlace 8.5 Hardware Specification for Cisco UCS Platforms
